reviews.text: This is one important place to visit when in DC.The place is extremely peaceful. It is spread across a huge area. The changing of guards is an important ceremony here. The atmosphere is very solemn and respectful. It has graves of some if the most honourable personalities in the American history including honourable John F Kennedy. I'll highly recommend this place.

Large and beautiful cemetery. It is worth visiting if in DC. Famous graves of john f Kennedy and generals of the us army are here. Take the tram tour around the cemetery to be able to see all of the areas.
I really enjoyed Arlington National Cemetery.  Wish I could have spent more time here :(  The grounds were very well kept!  Tons of history!  My kids enjoyed the changing of the guard.
One of my most favorite places ever visited. We made it there during Cherry Blossom season and it is just beautiful and so peaceful to walk around and see.

The cost of freedom... take it in. The grounds are beautiful, the sheer size and numbers of men and women, and their children, so impressive. The monuments very understated, far more so than the vibrant lives sacrificed to keep home and liberty safe.
Met the beautiful love of my life here on first date, happily married for 16 years and she even brings her boyfriend here and sometimes she lets me come with, I love it here! Never forget 9/11 also

I went there, accidentally entered an "Authorized Personnel Only" door, passed by a few doctors, and landed in a random vat of radioactive waste. Since then, I've been able to fly, shoot lasers out of my hands, and I've noticed that I seem to be bulletproof. I would absolutely recommend this experience to geometry enthusiasts everywhere!
Did not like the service. Advertised as a learning center yet when I walked through men in suits wrestled me and my child to the ground. So far my least favorite shape
15/10 keep up the good work  defending my Homeland!!! Keep the goy in their place, they're getting too uneasy......we may need to gas them.
Pretty low security, easy to get in and out with no one even noticing
Guide was very knowledgeable of the local artifacts
Interesting visit with some nice displays about local history. Don't expect to spend more than 30 minutes here though.
Great place to uncover Arlington history

This is a great last place to visit for the day. The memorial is great, but what's really impressive is the view you get from here since it is built on top of a hill. You can see the Washington, Jefferson, Lincoln memorials, the pentagon, the Kennedy center, the Capitol, part of Arlington Cemetery and more if you look hard. It has the best view of D.C in my opinion.
The only down side is that you need a car to get there, or a 20-30 min walk one way from Pentagon City Metro. Never had issues with parking this far.

I love this sculpture so much! The memorial is great to visit and very easy to park at, sure, and they have lovely events, but the real joy is seeing this as a part of the landscape every day. Beautiful! 😍

We waited too many years to visit here. After 37 years in the Air Force, you would think that we would have made it here sooner. Awesome monument...with a spectacular view of the 5-sided Puzzle Palace and downtown DC.
Loved it! Great memorial to our Air Force. I even had time to read the marquis. Well worth the walk through. The three spires are very impressive.

Nice memorial, limited parking spaces however. Good views of the Pentagon the Washington monument and the Capitol building from this point. Also some of Arlington cemetery is visible. There is no charge to get in.

The half smoke is the way to go here. Wish the bun was of better quality. The half smoke has a nice crunch and excellent flavor. The chili is good too, but being from Southern California I prefer the chili from a different local place. Don't get me wrong, it is good here. Got the spicy chili by accident on our chili fries and it's way too spicy for me and I like medium spicy heat.

Had heard about Ben's and did it deliver! Hot dog and sausage were spot on. Wonderful crunch to the sausage/hot dog. Chili had wonderful flavor and the fries hot and fresh.  Service was warm, friendly and quick. Awesome place for a quick bite!
Great food and quick service! The chili is always amazing and the staff is always making sure you have the best time possible. This place is a must go whenever in the area!
I don't know if you have to visit the orginal Ben's Chili Bowl or this is what they all are like, but I had a bad experience. Chili has no flavor, expensive ($1 for "cheese"), and dirty.
I'm coming back great food and people! I was sick the chili made me well.

No place around does the volume of meals as China Garden. It's a constant stop for Chinese tour buses on the weekend. Their dim sum is solid, but it's convenient if you're in DC or Arlington to get here compared to Falls Church or Silver Spring. The lady that runs the place can be a tad truculent, but she gives the place atmosphere.

Always feel free to reach out to me on Twitter @joerazz
Good Dim Sum food cart. It can get very busy during weekends due to tourist buses.  Excellent quality for Chinese party food. Unfortunately, they closed down in July 2017 and moved to Maryland.

Dim sum on a Saturday noon was surprisingly not busy.  The dumplings we're good, not great.  The roast duck was amazing, huge, fatty and full of flavor.  The ginger scallion lobster was also ok.  Service was very attentive.  Validated parking in the basement.

I used to be a motorcoach operator and brought many Asian Tour groups to this restaurant.
The food was always delicious. I was last at this restaurant in 2008.
If Asians eat at an Asian food establishment, the food has to be good. The food tastes just like quality restaurants in Chinatown, NYC

Pretty mediocre, but that might have been my bad for showing up right at the end of dim sum service. I got served cold squid, which luckily they replaced, and dumplings that had the stale texture of having been sitting out for hours. Would have been better if they had just told me no more dim sum.

The staff is so nice and the food is really good. We usually just get butter chicken to go, but my sister and I tried the buffet for the first time and I was good. I found other sides that I now like! Really good food. Would definitely go again.
We had a lovely dinner here. Nice staff and delicious food. Also good refillable masala tea! Great Clarendon restaurant!
I love this restaurant, especially the lunch buffet. Great selection, excellent quality, and equally great prices. Everyone I've brought here had agreed, even a friend from India.

My husband and I love Delhi Club. The food is great, they have plenty of vegetarian options, their location couldn't be better (right by the metro) and wonderful service. Get the samosas - you won't regret it.

Overall a nice place. Service was awesome. Apps and naan we're deliciousd. I ordered the butter chicken for my entree, but it was extremely sweet. It tasted like Campbell's tomato soup it was so sweet. Majot let down there as it's my favorite dish

I've lived in Arlington for going on 5 years, and this was my first time going to MeJana.  I'd seen it a million times, always telling myself that I'd go someday.  Well today was the day, and I wish I'd gone sooner.  

My fiance and I were looking for a restaurant that had outdoor seating as it was finally a nice day, and vegan options as we were meeting up with friends, one of whom is vegan.  The outdoor patio is very large and comfortable, you're not crowded in with everyone else.  The vegan options are extensive, delicious, and clearly identified on the menu.  

The service is similarly excellent.  All of our food was brought out amazingly quick, literally within 5 minutes of order everything, it was at our table.  And while we had our own designated server, all the staff pitched in to make sure we had everything we needed.  

To sum if up, great food, drinks, service, and location.  There's plenty on the menu we didn't try, so we'll be back for sure.  Highly recommend this place.

We went there because it receives 5 stars from many people so we had high expectation of the food. The starters were good but didn't meet my expectation of 5star to be honest. But the main course, lamb pilau, was just marvelous! Rice mixed with lamb and beans is contained in an egg crust bowl, and the looking and the taste, I have to say, is the best I have ever had in St. Louis. We also had custard for dessert, which is a good wrap up for dinner. Will definitely go there with friends next time!

Extremely friendly staff and great food, highly recommend! The staff made their best effort to accommodate our group of 10 guests without reservation on Friday night and helped us celebrate a special engagement occasion with paying special attention to us and taking pictures when we asked.  The food came fast and was delicious, both the starters and the main dishes, seafood and meat. Great place!

I rarely leave reviews, but this place is so deserving of one! It was awesome. The food, the presentation, the ambiance, the service -- everything was top notch and made for an amazing dining experience. Highly recommend checking this place out!

Hey, if this is your first time trying this restaurant then I would recommend that for 2 people you order 5-6 starters (cold or warm Mezza & flat bread - as they like to call it). This will be more than enough & you have a verity of Lebanese food. Lemonade with mint is quite good & try the chocolate cake with vanilla for dessert (be careful - it’s hot).

Good food and very affordable.  Great place to stop by if you have a chance during your lunch hour or if visiting town.  The #1 menu item / soup is a great choice with the flank steak.  A large size bowl is enough to fulfill the largest of appetites and only costs a dollar more.  Be prepared to pay cash or go to the ATM inside as this place does not accept credit cards.

A seriously delicious Pho restaurant. They only serve Pho but there are so many variations of what you can order. Great portions and prices. My husband and I got stationed here and we had a favorite spot back in California but now I think we've found our favorite East coast Pho place! I definitely recommend.

You must be very careful about your money at this restaurant. It happened more than two times that the cashier (the same person who is about 40-50 years old) refused to give us the changes in a very bad attitude alleging that he had given them to us, which is totally not true! Go check the footage! We didn't have time to argue with him yesterday so we didn't get our changes back. It's not just about the money but the attitude and honesty of the staff!
The best noodles in Arlington! Place is only cash, has mainly pho in the menu, and slowly has been improving in looks. Service is good. Unbeatable price! Usually crowded for lunch.

A very humble down to earth restaurant that specializes in Pho. Their menu is rather varied in this context so a fair number of options available. It’s been our go to place for Pho when we’re in VA! Usually quick service and very reasonably priced. Quality of the food has been excellent on every visit.

Absolutely hands down my favorite steakhouse in America.

I come here every time I’m in DC.

Not the fanciest, but they make up for it with steak that will blow your mind.

And the service is lovely!

Have the lobster bisque, a cowboy steak and enjoy the endless mash and spinach. (Truly, the mash is crazy good).

A genuine, honest to goodness steak house that knows how to cook a great steak.

If you like your steak medium rare like I do, you wont have to play games and intentionally order your steak rare in order to have it medium rare. 

I was genuinely pleased and surprised to find a place where rare (which I do also like) means rare and medium rare means medium rare. Highly recommended.

I understand a "no-frills" concept, however, the price point isn't really no-frills. Especially for the level of service received. We didn't mind the no-frills decor or table set up or silverware, etc. However, there still is an expectation for service, especially if you're tipping at a % of the total bill. We ordered 2 NY strips medium-rare which came out cooked differently. We asked the well-done to be re-cooked. There was no apology, nothing, in fact there was annoyance in our server's face. It's not our fault the kitchen can't cook 2 steaks the same. I threw our server an attitude, which she finally took a hint and a manager came over and apologized for the steak an gave us a cheesecake for dessert to make up for the mistake. Honestly, the steaks weren't seasoned all that well, it was no different than if we cooked our own steaks at home. I would rather pay a tad more for a great steakhouse experience. Skip this establishment.

I was a little disappointed this visit as they were out of the cowboy steak. But otherwise, I typically feel its a solidly good meal for an affordable price. The sides that come with the meal are good, endless so plentiful. Service is good as well. For a good steak I would definitely recommend.
BEST STEAK IN THE AREA BY FAR!!! Cheep wine and beer, great atmosphere and super friendly staff. Try the bone marrow!!! Love it and will be on my birthday there again!

We walked in at lunch and were seated in about 2 minutes. The restaurant was busy, but our service was still good. The tables are packed a little close, but I've seen worse. My veggie burger was good, but not the best I've had. The fries and pickles were both excellent. I'd eat there again.

First experience with paper straws.  If you like the flavor of cardboard, then these are for you!

But, my coworker and I are there twice when we were in town for business.  The bison is naturally drier than beef, so you want to order it medium or medium rare.  Great flavor.  The fries are pretty decent.  Both servers were really great.

We were on our way back to the condo when we found this place. Such a nice environment and country feel. The only regret is I wish I saw their hand crafted lemonade sign when we first got here haha. Probably the best damn lemonade I've had. Our server Alex was amazing. So kind and friendly. We ordered the steak and salmon. I loved their potatoes and gravy. We'll definitely be back next time we're passing through.

Ted's in Crystal City, Va is a great place to go for burgers.  They get you in/out in an hour at lunchtime.   Staff is friendly and attentive.  Gave it 4 out of 5 because this is the second time they didn't cook my burger the way I ordered it... too dry.

My friend and I decided to give Ted's a try for the first time this weekend and they didn't disappoint! Our server, Charnise, was very attentive throughout our meal and really helped make the experience great. The food was nothing short of phenomenal as well. I had the bison ribeye with mashed potatoes and a side Caesar salad. The bison was very tender and the exterior of the cut was well seasoned and didn't lack any flavor. The Caesar salad and mashed potatoes were both great as well, but they clearly weren't the star of the show here! My friend ordered the bison burger with a side of fries and she spoke highly of it. I tried a couple of her fries and they were fresh and crispy. Overall, a great experience and can't wait to go back!

I was there on a wedding day and this gentleman actually stole my jacket. So I was able to get in touch with the GM Katy S. Without any trouble at all she was on it looked at the video and had my very wonderful jacket back in less then a day. Thanks also great spot for any situation really the place is big enough to have a company party and still have enough room for the public to be able to come in and play pool shuffle board

OK so I hate to say it but it's your run of the mill after work happy hour. I've been there twice both times it was either crowded or not very many people there. On the night we went where the crowd was bustling they only had 3 bartenders total for 2 different bars. Very difficult to get drinks. But cool if you're just gonna pop in for a few min. Oh & outdated decor.

I visited strictly to watch a game during happy hour. I was quite impressed. Very good and attentive customer service, and outstanding prices on some draft beers, considering the area. $3 for selected drafts is a downright steal in this part of Arlington.
Service, food, pool tables. Bring your own cue. Good specials. A little crowded for real shooters after 5.
Cool spot to hang out and play some games with friends. Good food, cheap drinks, and lots of games. They have pool, ping pong, arcade games, board games, darts.  Lots of fun here!
